alternative_title: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing 'payments in kind'
body:
$!As an employer, payments you make to employees that can be converted into cash, eg a cheque, Savings Certificate or Premium Bond count as earnings.$!

You must:

+ add their value to your employee's other earnings
+ deduct and pay tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

##Technical guidance

Read more detailed information on [employment income: money's worth: benefits capable of being turned into money.](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim00540.htm "Employment income: money's worth: benefits capable of being turned into money"){:rel="external"}
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing 'payments in kind' that can be converted into cash (like cheques or premium bonds) to employees
title: Expenses and benefits: payments in kind that can be cashed in
